AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfredo Ortega-Chavez: Defendant and appellant convicted of conspiracy to bring or attempt to bring undocumented aliens into the United States, involved in smuggling operation with Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez and Alejandro Gonzalez Delgado, raised several claims of prejudicial error on appeal, including complaints about evidence of prior trips
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez: Co-conspirator, van driver, and participant in the smuggling operation with Ortega-Chavez and Alejandro Gonzalez Delgado, charged with attempting to bring illegal aliens into the United States, government witness with inconsistent testimony, testified about prior trips
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Judge Kazen: Trial court judge who conducted an inquiry into Mrs. Guerrero's ability to remain impartial and ensured a fair trial, also ordered stricken and instructed jury to disregard certain testimony
